alert.note: Alert for Clay; Wichita (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 6:09PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Clay and southeastern Wichita Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 608 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over northwestern Wichita Falls, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wichita Falls, Dean, Jolly, Sheppard AFB, Pleasant Valley, and Cashion. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
